    <item> 
      <title>Dreaming brain rhythms lock in memories</title>  
      <description>Disrupting brain activity during rapid eye movement (REM) sleep can stop mice from forming new memories, a study suggests.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36275143#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36275143</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:05:46 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>'25% of pregnancies' end in abortion</title>  
      <description>One in four pregnancies ends in an abortion each year, global estimates from the World Health Organization and Guttmacher Institute suggest.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36266873#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36266873</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 00:37:09 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/1B36/production/_89666960_healthcareworkerandwomanspl.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/4246/production/_89666961_healthcareworkerandwomanspl.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Shorter treatment 'will help tackle' TB</title>  
      <description>New guidelines from the World Health Organization aim to speed up the treatment of multi-drug resistant tuberculosis (MDR-TB).</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36271084#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36271084</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:27:49 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Zika virus 'shrinks brains' in tests</title>  
      <description>Zika virus can enter the brains of mice in the womb to stunt development, the first animal tests show.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36248691#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36248691</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 17:00:22 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Yellow fever 'global emergency' warning</title>  
      <description>Scientists in the US warn that the shortage of yellow fever vaccines could spark a global health emergency as the outbreak in Angola spreads.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-36256161#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-36256161</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 16:54:38 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Patients sent home 'with little support'</title>  
      <description>NHS patients in England are being sent home from hospital afraid and with little support, a report from the Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman reveals.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36250079#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36250079</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 07:11:42 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/8DC6/production/_89649263_img_0626.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/B4D6/production/_89649264_img_0626.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Being overweight 'now less unhealthy'</title>  
      <description>Being overweight may not be as unhealthy as it was 40 years ago, Danish research suggests.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36258515#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36258515</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 16:58:21 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/E515/production/_89654685_obese147220211.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/11C29/production/_89654727_obese147220211.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Youthful 'second skin' to hide wrinkles</title>  
      <description>Scientists say they have developed an invisible elastic film that can be applied to the skin to reduce the appearance of wrinkles and eye bags.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36245728#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36245728</guid>  
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 15:13:08 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Hundreds suffer vomiting bug on UK ship</title>  
      <description>Hundreds of passengers on a British cruise ship docked in the US have fallen ill with norovirus, health officials say.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-36245284#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-36245284</guid>  
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 16:12:15 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Global sleeping patterns revealed</title>  
      <description>The world's sleeping patterns have been revealed by scientists analysing data collected from an app.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36226874#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36226874</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 23:02:17 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Skin bacteria stay 'stable over time'</title>  
      <description>Everyone has their own personal range of bacteria living on their skin that stays largely unchanged over time, a US study suggests.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36213697#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36213697</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 00:20:32 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/15338/production/_89604868_p7010617-daisy_in_between_toes-spl.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/17A48/production/_89604869_p7010617-daisy_in_between_toes-spl.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Soft drinks named in tooth decay battle</title>  
      <description>Health officials in Liverpool are tackling "an alarming level" of child tooth decay in the city by outlining the amounts of sugar in soft drinks.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-merseyside-36247176#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-merseyside-36247176</guid>  
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 13:49:01 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>NHS should welcome 'citizen whistleblowers'</title>  
      <description>Why the NHS should listen to people who see something amiss</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-30333071#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-30333071</guid>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>'Cancer made me want mashed potato'</title>  
      <description>The strange effects of cancer on appetite</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-31641689#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Video game 'speeds dementia research'</title>  
      <description>Dementia researchers develop a video game they hope could further the development of diagnostic tests for the disease.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36203675#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36203675</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 04 May 2016 16:39:50 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: How a new vaccine could eradicate polio</title>  
      <description>More than 150 countries are switching to a different vaccine to target polio.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36076991#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36076991</guid>  
      <pubDate>Mon, 18 Apr 2016 18:10:29 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Trapped in an institution for seven years</title>  
      <description>Debbie Evans talks about her son who has learning disabilities and has lived in a medical institution for seven years</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36058020#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36058020</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 15 Apr 2016 17:22:11 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Surgery live-streamed in virtual reality</title>  
      <description>The operation of a patient undergoing surgery for colon cancer is streamed-live using virtual reality video.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36046948#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36046948</guid>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Should children learn about infertility?</title>  
      <description>Victoria Derbyshire speaks to a panel of guests about a project to teach teenagers about the issue of infertility.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36046245#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36046245</guid>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: 'No doubt' Zika causes birth defects</title>  
      <description>Health officials in the United States have confirmed that the Zika virus in pregnant women causes babies to be born with unusually small heads and severe brain abnormalities.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-36041948#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-36041948</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 14 Apr 2016 02:29:51 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Should we eat more fish?</title>  
      <description>Across Asia people eat more fish than anywhere else in the world, but there is a potential danger as mercury and other chemicals are found in fish.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35884051#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35884051</guid>  
      <pubDate>Sat, 09 Apr 2016 23:04:49 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: 'I'd think twice': BBC tests new food label</title>  
      <description>The BBC has been asking shoppers what they think of the idea of being given food labels with exercise advice.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35990098#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35990098</guid>

      <title>'This is what it's like to pee after female genital mutilation'</title>

      <title>How Frozen helped a little girl with albinism</title>
